meaning: To combine in having an effect; act together.
To occur at the same time; happen together; coincide.
To agree (with); be in accord (in an opinion, etc.)
sentences: The Senate refused to concur in the amendment and the whole measure was lost.
After reading this, I decided I concur.
We do not now concur with the old view that inflammation was essentially an injurious process; rather do we look upon it as beneficial to the organism.
